Message.Title: The Sony vs. Microsoft price war is a side-show to the death of console gaming itself
Message.Msg: Google it... Quoting: "It’s a tough time to be a hard-core gamer. Veterans of the gaming industry are declaring that we are in the midst of the death of “console gaming” itself—i.e. the end of those set-top boxes made by Sony, Microsoft and Nintendo that have long been the staples of video gaming. Sales of video games have been in a tailspin for the past four years, and in April sales of both software and consoles were down 25% from a year earlier. "So when Sony today launches a “price war“ by announcing that its next-generation PlayStation 4 will retail for $399, $100 less than Microsoft’s next-generation console, the Xbox One, it’s hard to see it as anything other than a retreat by the industry, designed to lure people back to consoles by making them cheaper. "What’s killing consoles? As with the PC, it appears to be mobile devices...."

Message.Title: Sony Outduels Microsoft in First PS4-Xbox One Skirmish
Message.Msg: Google it... Quoting: "Sony Corp. (6578)’s PlayStation 4 won the initial skirmish over next-generation video-game consoles by exploiting the weak spots in Microsoft Corp (MSFT).’s plan for the Xbox One: price and used-game policies. " ... "The result has been a rapid shift in expectations for the two machines, with Sony gaining the upper hand with fans and early sales against Microsoft, the console leader for the past two years. The Xbox One will sell for a premium-priced $499 and limit users’ ability to buy, trade and resell games. Sony, once dominant in the industry, came in $100 cheaper and won’t limit transactions, and has been rewarded with a boom in orders. “ 'A lot of people who are hardcore gamers are going to be turned off by the Xbox One,' said Gabe Bethke, 19, a sophomore at Occidental College in Los Angeles, who watched online and owns an Xbox 360. 'It has too many rules and restrictions.' ”

Message.Title: M$ gets the XBox 1 pretty much 100% wrong
Message.Msg: No second hand games. Well, you might be able to sell *some* games on, dependent on how benevolent the developers are feeling, but buying a second hand game is gonna end up with you paying a fee to use it if you're allowed to do so. No backwards compatibility. MS want it to be the one box in your living room. Unless you want to play your old XBox games, that is. It's launching $100 more expensive than the more-powerful PS4. No more XBLIG / XBLA, far as I can tell. You need a publisher or a publishing deal from MS. Goodbye, small developers. They've taken the goodwill they have from the 360, and #$%$ it away. All of it. So what's the one thing they didn't get wrong? No more MS points, instead online purchases using local currency. It's about the only thing that got heartfelt applause during the Xb one thing at E3. I suspect they were gambling on Sony, who are known for their draconian behaviour, to get it more wrong.

Message.Title: Easy way to get rid of the FBI Virus
Message.Msg: This afternoon I got the FBI virus on my home computer. You can see the screen image if you just google it. It does look official. I can see how it could frighten people into paying $300 by MoneyPak to the scammers. The virus just locks up my computer. All of the sites which discuss how to remove the virus are actually trying to sell me their software. I wonder if any of these anti-virus companies are involved in the creation of this virus? In order to install anti-virus software, I tried going into the safe mode by pushing F8, but the virus would switch the computer back to the regular mode and lock the screen. After a frustrating few hours, I decided to do a system restore. It stated that my system would be restored back to just 3 days earlier. It also stated that my documents would not be lost. Well the system restore worked perfectly. All of my documents are intact, including one I had saved just one hour before the virus occurred. How come system restore is not mentioned as an option to fix a virus problem? Does anyone know if there are any adverse effects when this procedure is used?
